content.prompt: The chart and map best illustrate which of the following aspects of human interactions with the environment in the late twentieth century?

choices.label: Industrialization led to increasingly hazardous levels of air and water pollution.
Economic development policies intensified competition over limited natural resources.
Urbanization dramatically expanded the per capita rates of freshwater consumption.
Climate change led to increasing desertification in drought-prone regions.

topic.text: 9.3: Technological Advances - Debates about the Environment after 1900

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
